2. Mediation: When direct dialogue between parties is not possible, a third party mediator can help facilitate communication and negotiation. 3. Conflict resolution strategies: There are various conflict resolution strategies that can be employed to help resolve disputes. These include problem-solving workshops, community dialogues, and restorative justice approaches. 4. Nonviolent resistance: Nonviolent resistance involves using peaceful means to protest, demonstrate, and resist oppression. This can include civil disobedience, peaceful protests, and other forms of nonviolent action. Nonviolent resistance is grounded in the belief that violence only begets violence, and that peaceful means can be more effective in bringing about social and political change.

Overall, there are many alternatives to violence and oppression when resolving conflicts. These approaches require collaboration, trust-building, and a willingness to listen and compromise. Effective conflict resolution involves understanding different perspectives and interests and working together to find common ground and build sustainable peace.
